channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Huawei announces new AI infrastructure as Nvidia gets locked out of China
item.description: Huawei's SuperPoD interconnect technology creates clusters of chips, including AI chips, to increase compute.

item.title: Raising Series A in 2026: Insights from Top Early-Stage VCs at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.description: Katie Stanton (Moxxie Ventures), Thomas Krane (Insight Partners), and Sangeen Zeb (GV) share how to win Series A funding in 2026 at TechCrunch Disrupt...

item.title: You Can Save $200 on Samsung’s Elite Gaming Monitor Today
item.description: This is one of the biggest, baddest screens you can game on, and it’s marked down to less than the smaller version.

item.title: Brendan Carr Isn't Going to Stop Until Someone Makes Him
item.description: In the wake of Jimmy Kimmel's suspension, experts say the FCC commissioner's conduct is flatly unconstitutional. They also expect him to keep going.

item.title: Tim Cook, Sam Altman, and more attend Trump’s UK state banquet
item.description: Top tech names were on the guest list for the banquet thrown for President Trump during his second state visit to the UK on Wednesday.

item.title: Move Aside, Chatbots: AI Humanoids Are Here
item.description: Today on Uncanny Valley, we talk about why the AI industry is investing in the development of humanoid robots, and what that means for us non-robots.

item.title: How AI startups are fueling Google’s booming cloud business
item.description: Google Cloud is one of the company's fastest-growing business lines, and continues to rack up new customers.

item.title: US government charges British teenager accused of at least 120 ‘Scattered Spider’ hacks
item.description: Thalha Jubair, 19, was arrested in London on Thursday and accused by U.K. and U.S. authorities of involvement in dozens of hacks, including London's t...

item.title: Jensen Huang Wants You to Know He’s Getting a Lot Out of the ‘Fantastic’ Nvidia-Intel Deal
item.description: Nvidia is investing $5 billion in Intel. The news comes after the US government took a roughly 10 percent equity stake in the struggling chipmaker.

item.title: No One Knows What ‘Terminally Online’ Means Anymore
item.description: The memes and online footprint of Charlie Kirk shooting suspect Tyler Robinson don’t place him neatly in a box, though many are still trying.
